results.title: A Dancer's grammar
results.brief_description: Many films which pertain to dance and dancers tend to show only the seemingly effortless end product, while generally ignoring the hours of preparation that are involved. This film succinctly communicates the paradox of beauty achieved through sweat and diligence by focusing on the different preparations of two ballet dancers, Lois Bewley and Lawrence Rhodes. Photography by Peter Sova. No commentary - music only.

results.title: A Cruel inheritance (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The problems and options of parents who risk passing on an inherited disease to their children are discussed. The program uses case studies of families with sickle cell anaemia and cystic fibrosis.

results.title: A Craven
results.creator_credit: Anne Algar and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Smoker Jenny Craven recounts the tortuous process of quitting smoking - which is proving as difficult as they predict when everything seems to be conspiring against her. Features the voices of Jean Kitson and Brian Nankervis.

results.title: A Conversation with Walter Gropius and Frederic Day
results.creator_credit: Robert D. Graff, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: An interview with Walter Gropius, architect and founder of the Bauhaus School of Design and chairman of the Department of Architecture at the Graduate School of Design, Havard University. Gropius discusses his views and theories on architecture and design. An exponent of teamwork, Gropius founded the Bauhaus School in Dessau on the notion of collaboration between designers and artisans. By combining theory and practice, the school equipped students with the skills to develop a project from the design stage to production. Marcel Breuer and Mies van der Rohe were graduates of the school while Paul Klee was amongst the teaching staff. Gropius also discusses his views on architecture, stressing the need for designers to consider the spiritual and mental wellbeing of humans when developing functional spaces. Photographed by Jesse Sabin and Joe Vadala. Sound by Jerry Gold. Edited by Robert Loweree.

results.title: A City awakens
results.brief_description: A non-narrated film showing the sights and sounds of a city as it gradually comes to life in the early morning. The film begins before dawn until each part awakens. As the city prepares for the day, the rhythm builds and builds.

results.title: A City's child
results.creator_credit: Brian Kavanagh, Experimental Film and Television Fund of the Australian Council for the Arts and Kavanagh Productions
results.brief_description: An award-winning dramatic treatment of individual loneliness in a large city. Monica Maughan plays a spinster approaching middle age who lives with a dominating mother. After the death of her mother, unable to make human contact, she slips into a fantasy world in which a small doll becomes her “daughter”. The film was shot on 16mm for about $30,000.

results.title: A Circus story
results.creator_credit: Marshall Riggan, Major Carpenter, Barr Films and Marshall Majors Productions
results.brief_description: An account of the arrival, setting up and the performance of a circus in the small town of Berrybille, Arkansas, USA. Discusses the status, role and function of the circus today and suggests reasons for the romantic appeal of the circus. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: A Children's welcome
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: This film was made in honour of the Queen Mother’s visit to Melbourne on March 3rd, 1958. A performance for the Queen Mother, by the school children of Victoria, was staged at the Melbourne Cricket Ground with items arranged by the Physical Education Department and accompanied by the RAAF Band. Family and friends were gathered in the stands of the MCG to watch and cheer on the children. At the end of the performance, the Queen Mother toured in an open car around the MCG.
